results.title: The Bass Valley Community Centre
results.brief_description: When Clare Le Serve started a craft group for young mums in the early 1980s, she could not have imagined that it would grow over the next 30 years to become such an amazing community asset. With the help of local volunteers and paid staff, the Community Centre offers essential services that make a positive impact on the people of Bass and the surrounding Waterline region in south-eastern Victoria.

results.title: The Basket worm
results.brief_description: Describes the life cycle of the basket worm, from chrysalis to moth, how it builds its nest, and where it is found in its natural surroundings. No other credits available.

results.title: The Basics of cross country skiing
results.brief_description: Demonstration of the basic techniques for cross country skiing. Looks also at the different kinds of skiing equipment available. Shows best ways of setting up camp in the snow.

results.title: The Basic elements of production
results.brief_description: Compares the simple production of hand-made pottery with modern mass production methods, showing the basic similarities in the two processes. Emphasizes the interdependence of natural resources, labour, capital, and management in both processes. Explains the role of the consumer in the production of goods and services and in regulating their supply. No credits available.

results.title: The Barretts of Wimpole Street
results.creator_credit: Sam Zimbalist, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Sidney A. Franklin
results.brief_description: A dramatic portrayal of the romance of poets, Elizabeth Barrett (Jennifer Jones) and Robert Browning (Bill Travers). The invalid poetess who regains her health after falling in love with the famous poet elopes with the poet against the wishes of her tyrannical father (John Gielgud), who exhibits an incestuous attachment for Elizabeth, as well as an over domineering control of all the Barrett siblings in their personal adult relationships. The story is set in London, England, starting in the year, 1845. Cast also includes Virginia McKenna, Susan Stephen, Vernon Gray.

results.title: The Barossa
results.creator_credit: Albert Falzon Productions, South Australian Film Corporation and David Lourie
results.brief_description: Unsurpassed scenery, friendly people, vintage festivals, a pleasant sip of wine and unrivalled cuisine - all are part of the Barossa. This film shows the places, people and traditional events which make the Barossa Valley one of Australia’s most exciting wine districts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Albert Falzon Productions, South Australian Film Corporation and David Lourie

results.title: The Bargain
results.creator_credit: W.M. Larkins Studio, Film Producers Guild and Beryl Stevens
results.brief_description: An animated film on how to buy a steam roller without enough ready money. The intending purchaser is shown the advantages of everyday banking and the services offered by the modern bank to its customer. Designed to convince the ordinary wage earner that it is sensible for several reasons to have a current account with a bank.

results.title: The Barefoot contessa
results.creator_credit: Forrest E. Johnston, United Artists Corporation, Figaro Films and Joseph L Mankiewicz
results.brief_description: Maria Vargas (Ava Gardner) is a poor nightclub dancer in Madrid who is discovered by film director Harry Dawes (Humphrey Bogart). Dawes takes Maria to Rome and she becomes one of the world’s biggest movie stars. However, she finds that the glamorous world of the movies is a facade and descends into a bleak isolation, surrounded by sleazy dealers, syncophantic hangers-on and self-obsessed lovers. “The Barefoot Contessa” is both a rich and sumptuous Hollywood melodrama filmed in glorious colour and a savage indictment of the materialism and greed that dominates commercial filmmaking. Powerfully acted, brilliantly directed and with a script that included the uncredited involvement of screenwriters blacklisted during the McCarthyite “witch-hunts”, this film manages to be one of those rare Hollywood films that both entertain and disturb. The cast includes Bessie Love, Valentina Cortesa and Rossano Brazzi in an excellent performance as Maria’s impotent, possibly bisexual husband.

results.title: The Barber of Seville by Rossini
results.brief_description: Rossini’s comic opera, sung in Italian. One of a series of “opera-films”, which feature the chorus and orchestra and some of the principals of the Rome Opera House, La Scala, Milan, and other famous Italian opera companies; each film combines scenes from a performance of the opera with an english-language commentary which explains the plot and telescopes the action. Features Tito Gobbi as Figaro.

results.title: The Barber of Seville = Il Barbiere di Siviglia
results.brief_description: Fast, funny and furious, Rossini’s “Barber of Seville” boasts a torrent of sparkling music, while John Cox’s production adds its own distinctive lustre to this comic masterpiece enhanced by John Rawnsley’s fine comic acting portrayal of Figaro and Maria Ewing’s bewitching Rosina. The London Symphony Orchestra is conducted by the young French conductor, Sylvain Cambreling. Sung in Italian. No subtitles.
